headline: Mini Key Lime Pies
description: Nothing taste better than key lime pie made with fresh key limes. This one is really tasty and super simple to make. Mini pies are great because everyone can have their own.
name: Mini Key Lime Pies
recipeIngredient: 1 cup freshly squeezed Key lime juice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place mini graham cracker crusts onto a baking sheet.
In a bowl, whisk together the sweetened condensed milk, sour cream, Key lime juice, and Key lime zest until smooth. Pour the filling into the graham cracker crusts, filling to the top.

Bake in the preheated oven until hot, 5 to 8 minutes. Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, at least 1 hour. To serve, garnish each mini pie with a Key lime slice and a dollop of whipped cream topping.

review.reviewBody: Way to much condensed milk.... almost 3 cans of condensed milk is way too much...threw away a lot of the batter.....14 oz can of condensed milk is actually measured by weight not volume it's actually 1 1/4 cup volume or 10 oz volume. Made it better the second time using 2 cups 16oz volume which is about 1 and 3/4 cans.
Very tasty as written (and super easy to make!). Was well received and got lots of compliments. Made my own graham cracker crust and used a mini muffin tin to make perfect bite size ‚Äúpies‚Äù.

Made these for my daughters gender revival party. Everyone loved them. There was not one left Just wondering if any of you have tried this recipe for making a large pie instead of the mini ones? Please let me know I would appreciate it. Thanks. üòä
Good but not traditional key lime pie so if you are looking for a traditional key lime pie recipe, this is not it.
We love this recipe! So easy to make! This is a perfect summer dessert that we will definitely make again!

The key lime pies came out great! But the measurements on the website got all messed up. It went from saying 3 cups of sweetened condensed milk for 12 serving size to 3/4 of a cup when you DOUBLED the recipe... then when I went back to a regular serving (serves 12) it changed to 1/3 and 2 tps of sweetened condensed milk. When I would refresh the page it went back to 3 cups of it again... over all that was very confusing and I ended up doubling the recipe to make 24 mini pies and used 4, 14oz cans of sweetened condensed milk which tasted great! The only other thing was it didn‚Äôt make 24 mini pies.... the ‚Äúdoubling the recipe‚Äù to make 24 mini pies ended up really making 24 mini pies, and TWO ENTIRE pies. Long story short, the measurements are way off. It makes way too much... but it tastes great! 
Also I couldn‚Äôt find any pre made graham cracker shells so I made my own graham cracker crust and it came out great. 1 cup graham cracker crumbs, 6 TBSP butter, & 1/3 cup of sugar. I did use paper cupcake liners and it worked perfect... I saw in another comment to use foil ones if you make your own crust cause the butter soaked the paper but I didn‚Äôt experience that at all. 
I was actually happy that I made my own crust and used the paper cupcake liners because it came out amazing. 
Definitely will use this recipe again but will be careful with the measurements so I don‚Äôt make enough to feed an army and all the neighbors lol. 
Super delicious though! Definitely recommend making
Loved this recipe!! Followed it exactly, just baked for a few extra minutes until it was set. Had many people tell me this was the best key lime pie they‚Äôve ever had!

I would put 3/4 cup sour cream vs 1 cup, but other then that, A++++

Very easy to make!
Made these for a party big hit. I got 17 tarts out of one batch if I had the 18 all at once I would of squeezed it i. Very good
This was too easy for how good it was. It was perfect. I will definitely make it again.
No changes. They turned out perfectly.

made it last year for a friends wedding because it was his favorite dessert and he told me best he has ever had! For myself it was the first time having key lime pie and it was a great introduction with this recipe!

My Key lime tree is going crazy so l have been squeezing and freezing juice . I needed a quick dessert for a lunch party and found this wonderful recipe. Whipped it up in no time and still had enough time to chill them in time for lunch. Guests loved them!
This turned out great and was super easy. I used lime and it was fine. The sour cream cut down on the tartness. My husband loved it.
Simple, quick and delish!
A+ I've made key lime pies for a few years. Wanted to try a new twist... This is it! Perfect combo, smooth, tangy and so tasty. I like the sour cream in place of eggs. My new key lime!
Delish. I tried this recipe for Christmas Eve and then made it again for friends on New Year‚Äôs Eve. So easy and scrumptious.
tasty fool proof fast

I made the recipe as directed, other than substituting Key Limes for Rangpur Limes (a mandarin/lemon fruit). I used the Keebler mini-crusts from the grocery store and they turned out FANTASTIC! Even partygoers that do not typically eat dessert had one and ate every bite. My only wish is that I had a larger tree, since this took up almost all of my ripe fruit. Couldn't recommend this recipe more!
Great taste
I made these for a small group and they were a huge hit and so easy to make. I'd have to give these a 5 star rating.

I followed the directions exactly (except I made my own graham cracker crust) and it turned out delicious! It was very easy to make and was a hit with my guest. It is very rich and creamy. I used small key limes I wouldn't recommend that because it took forever to squeeze the juice and it was hard to grate the rind. Which is a must to get the great flavor. Next time I will buy larger key limes. My husband even enjoyed this one and he doesn't like key lime pie. This one is a keeper!
Fabulous! The best I have ever had. I received the same comment from every one I made them for. Didn't change a thing and I think the sour cream is what makes these extra special. Thanks for sharing.
Half recipe made 8 little pies. Great hit! Will make often. Rivals the famous key lime made by one of the restaurants here! Not sure about nutritional content..

Just made these. Halved the recipe just to try it. Used reduced fat condensed milk 14 oz can and light sour cream. Used regular limes. Omg! Omg! Delicious. Tangy with the right amount of sweet. Can't wait to make these for a family get together.

These are the best! Instead of buying the little pie plates I just used a muffin tin. I made my own crust with butter and gram crackers. I ended up having a lot left over and have enough to make mini mini key lime pies! This is a great recipe and I have already made it multiple times! I highly recommend this recipe!
I had no choice but to use regular limes and the pies were still delicious! Other than the type of lime, I followed the recipe exactly and everyone in my family loved them.

These were a hit. I could not find the graham cracker crusts that this called for so I had to make my own. Just a suggestion if you have to make your own crust use foil cup cake liners and not paper because the butter really seeped through and was a little messy.
So delicious & refreshing!
Easy to make & very tasty...will be making some for the Holiday's...
These were so extremely easy to make and very tasty.
These were great. Half the recipe produced 7 little pies for us. Thanks for the recipe

I have made these twice and they are wonderful and so easy! The grated zest is a nice touch. The first time, I made 6 for a small dinner party and halved the recipe. Tonight, I attended a dinner party for 15. Was able to fill 15 shells with the 12 pie recipe amounts. Topped with some raspberries and blueberries and served with mini cream puffs from another recipe on this site and chocolate covered strawberries. Made a very pretty plate with a nice assortment. Was devoured. Thanks for the recipe!
I am using this for my class project! It works really well.

I cut the recipe in half and just made 6. I followed the recipe exactly, and they came out great! If you like your pie super limey, add more lime. I don't like an overpowering lime flavor in my key lime pie, or I feel like it starts to taste fake. This flavor was refreshing and perfect. They don't expand in the oven so go ahead and fill them all the way to the top like it says. I baked them for 6 minutes, cooled slightly, then chilled them. They were ready within an hour of being put into the fridge, but I left them overnight anyway. To fancy them up, I added some lime zest to the top along with a couple lemon balm leaves from my garden. Cute!
made this for teacher's birthday. The recipe is sweet with the perfect amount of tartness. Make sure you use key lime juice if possible. It makes a big difference!

Oh my! The BEST! Made these tonight for my mom's bday (key lime pie is her favorite), and very very picky about her key lime pie!!! These were a HUGE hit, and I even had requests to make them for upcoming birthdays!! I omitted the lime zest, mainly because I was short of time, but I'm sure its good either way! Highly highly recommend!!! ;)
I made 3 dozen and all but my two i stashed away were eaten!!!!
Very easy, and very tasty! I couldn't find key limes, so I used regular limes, and it still tasted good.
Super fun and super easy. Everyone liked them, even the kids!
